articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Donald Trump on Thursday urged a federal judge to toss out two obstruction charges central to the case that the former U.S. president illegally sought to overturn his 2020 election defeat, citing a recent U.S. Supreme Court ruling raising the legal bar for those offenses.
articles.title: Trump moves to toss Jan. 6 obstruction charges, citing Supreme Court ruling

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said the country would not hesitate to use all available offensive forces including nuclear weapons if the enemy attempted to use force to encroach on its sovereignty, state news agency KCNA reported on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea leader Kim threatens nuclear response if sovereignty breached, KCNA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 11 people were killed and dozens injured in an overnight attack in a Haitian town led by the Gran Grif gang, local newspaper Le Nouvelliste reported on Thursday, as powerful armed gangs expand their influence from the capital.
articles.title: Thousands flee gang killings in Haiti breadbasket town, media reports

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Fabian Hamacher, Ann Wang
articles.description: Southern Taiwan worked on Friday to clear up damage from flooding and high winds after Typhoon Krathon slammed into a major metropolis, while most of the rest of the island resumed work and financial markets re-opened.
articles.title: Taiwan clears up, slowly re-opens after hit from Typhoon Krathon

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Tim Walz, Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris's running mate, on Thursday promised Muslim Americans an equal role in their administration should they win the election, as Democrats scramble to win back Muslim backing that has eroded over U.S. support for Israel.
articles.title: Walz promises Muslims an equal role in Harris administration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States and four other countries discussed the need to finalize plans for the new African Union stabilization and support mission in Somalia, the U.S. Department of State said in a statement on Thursday.
articles.title: US, allies discuss 'urgent need' to finalize plans for new African Union mission in Somalia

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Google said on Friday it will stop linking to New Zealand news articles and ditch the agreements it has with local news organisations, if the country’s government goes ahead with a law to force tech giants to pay a fair price for content that appears on their feeds.
articles.title: Google says it will stop linking to New Zealand news if proposed new law passed

articles.author: Alistair Smout, Michael Holden, Villen Anganan
articles.description: Britain said on Thursday it would cede sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius in a deal it said secured the future of the UK-U.S. Diego Garcia military base, and which could also pave the way for people displaced decades ago to return home.
articles.title: UK cedes Chagos Island sovereignty to Mauritius, retains Diego Garcia airbase

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ghana's health service has reported the country's first case of mpox this year, without disclosing which variant had been recorded, according to a statement.
articles.title: Ghana reports first mpox case but variant not yet clear
